1.title: It all starts here

111.content:
It had started out like any other day. It was early March, you had woken up and taken a quick shower. You brush your thin beard, and tie your shoulder-length brown hair into a short ponytail. Throwing on some lighter clothes, you climb into your truck and head to work. You worked in a refinery, forging the molten metal into sheets. It was hard work, the sweltering heat and heavy machinery made sure of that, and you hated every moment of it.

Recently there had been large groups of people protesting the facility, claiming that it was a hazard to the environment. The crowds made it nearly impossible to actually get inside,and they were getting more numerous every day. You could see them as you pulled up, blocking the front doors. You park your car in the front lot and make your way towards the front door. The crowd pulled at your clothes, shouting profanities and insults. You do your best to ignore them and push through. as you open the door however something occurs to you.

"YOU'RE ALL BREAKING THE LAW" after a moment of stunned silence the crowd begins to rage at your allegations, "YOU'RE BLOCKING THE FIRE ESCAPE ROUTE" you roar over their indignant cries "IT'S A FEDERAL OFFENSE" You enter the building and slam the door shut behind you.

"HIGGS You're late, and how many times do I have to tell you not to aggravate the protestors?" your supervisor calls down from one of the balconies "Get your ass in gear and get to your station,"

"I'll get my ass in gear when you get your ass in shape" you mutter to yourself as you grab your protective gear.

The rest of the day goes by as any other would, you shape and temper steel into the sheets required by many industries. Your ten hours are over before you realize, and you make your way out of the building, back through the crowd. Several of them seem to recognize you and one holds you back, you twist out of his grip only for something to hit you in the back.

"What the fuck" you turn to see a man holding a protest sign like a bat winding up for another swing. The crowd creates a space around the two of you as you duck under his second swing. You do your best to stay out of reach but the small circle makes that easier said than done. He's swinging like a madman, as if he was personally offended by your joke earlier. You just try not to engage, dodge rolling and sidestepping as much as your body will allow, eventually however you can't keep up and the solid wood pole hits you alongside the head,

"Gah!" you fall to the side clutching your right eye. Another blow hits your shoulder wracking your body with pain, you can hear your aggressor laughing and suggesting you keep your mouth shut in the future. You can barely see him winding up for a final swing.

It's all too much...

You white out














The first thing that comes back to you is the smell, blood. Next is sound, the people murmuring in hushed voices. Then sight, and you see what you've done. Your aggressor now lies crumpled on the ground, bleeding from all over his body, arms and legs twisted at disturbing angles, bones poking out in several places. His face is swollen and bloodied, teeth missing. There is little chance he's still alive. It takes you a moment to realize that you probably killed him. The bloodied sign pole in your hands confirms this. You take a few unsteady steps, and the crowd parts before you.

Run,

The fear fills your head, blocking out all other thought.

"I have to get away," You are much steadier as you reach your truck. Hopping up into the front seat, you start it up and peel out of the lot. You drive quickly, breaking several laws and ignoring speed limits. Your house was on the edge of your small mountain town, bordered on all sides by the forest. you throw the door open and begin to tear through your things looking for your camping supplies. You had gone camping numerous times in the past and you were confident in your survival skills. It doesn't take you long to find it, your hiking bag filled with your supplies. Some rain gear, a cooking pot, survival knife, rope, matches, a single person tent and various other small items. While searching you come across an item you thought you had gotten rid of. A pokeball, nothing special about it other than the M written carefully on it, almost worn away by age.

Just as you sling the bag over your shoulder something slams into your front door. "THIS IS THE POLICE, WE KNOW YOU'RE IN THERE, COME OUT WITH YOUR HANDS UP"

"Shit they're already here" You had to hand it to her Jenny worked fast. "YOU CAN'T RUN ETHAN THIS IS YOUR LAST CHANCE"

You're already moving, grabbing a chair and heaving it through one of your rear windows. Apparently they heard, because your front door explodes in a ball of flame, and an Arcanine leaps through, you throw yourself out the window and make a mad dash for the woods.

The woods were a restricted area, enforced by law, it was illegal for anyone to enter, even police. You figure they won't follow you if you get far enough. The woods are restricted because of an unusually high number of deaths and disappearances in recent years. Around thirty percent of people who entered this forest didn't exit. It was deemed an unsafe area. You had been hiking and camping in these woods since you were a child. you had never once felt threatened or gotten lost, so you chalked up the disappearances to peoples stupidity, Your father had been quite a survivalist and taught you everything you know.

You run for as long as you can, and eventually fall to your knees exhausted. As you had hoped, there are no signs of pursuit. You take a moment and catch your breath. you realize that through all this you were still holding onto the pokeball, with a sigh you shove it into your pocket. A quick survey of your surroundings reveals that you are in a decent site for camp, level ground, some open space for a tent, and judging from the sound, a stream nearby.

"Great, I'll just set up here" It only takes you a few minutes to set up your tent, and just under half an hour to make a fire pit. At this point it was getting dark and wandering around in an unfamiliar environment isn't the best idea, especially at night, so you just crawl into your tent and go to sleep.
111.title: Ethan's story

1111.content:
"Get out" a voice tears you from your sleep,

"There's no way they caught up that quickly"

"I said get out, I will drag you out if I have to" Something about the voice is slightly off, but you can't put your finger on exactly what. Very slowly you unzip the door to the tent and step out. It's still somewhat dark, standing on the other side of your camp is something that worries you greatly. A Bisharp. You have no way to defend yourself from the powerful dark-type. If it wanted, it could easily kill you.

"Good you came out on your own, I was about to cut you out," you remain silent, it's not impossible for a pokemon to learn english, but it's not exactly common. "Do you know where you are?"

"I have a general idea"

"You are in the territory of our pack," you gulp, pokemon packs are extremely dangerous, defending their territory fiercely,

"Alright my bad I didn't know, I'll just get my stuff and get out of the area"

"I'm afraid it won't be that simple"

"Shit, look I don't want any trouble I can just get out of here, you'll never see me again. I won't tell anyone that you're here"

"I believe you, but the Alpha's orders are absolute. You will come with me, Alpha will decide your fate" You deepen your breaths saturating your blood with oxygen to prepare yourself for exertion. "Don't try anything, you can't outrun me and you definitely can't fight me," Your eyes flick left and right looking for anything that you could use to escape, but there's nothing. You sigh, "Well, looks like I don't really have a choice, just let me collect my stuff," Bisharp nods and waits for you to pack up camp, you hadn't used much so it only took a few minutes to pack everything up.

"Alright lets get this over with"

"Right, follow me" he sets off at a moderate pace, and despite the pit in your stomach you follow. You follow for several hours, until Bisharp stops and begins to speak. "We are about to enter the main camp, the standing order is to take any outsiders found in our territory straight to Alpha for judgement, most of the time its pokemon so I don't know how Alpha will handle this, but since you couldn't have known you were in our territory I doubt you'll receive a punishment"

"Why are you telling me all this, I thought wild packs hated humans,"

"Well, I'm sure some do, but we don't really have any reason to hate humans. So few of you make it to our territory that it's never been an issue," he pauses for a moment "There are a few of us who have history with humans so they might be somewhat hostile but I doubt they'd try anything in the presence of Alpha,"

You think for a moment, "You mentioned punishment, do you know what I can expect?"

"I'm afraid not, most pokemon are offered a choice, join the pack or die" a shiver runs down your spine. "But hey like I said you're not a pokemon"

"That's...comforting,"

"Alright, come with me" he leads you to a fallen tree and pulls aside a sheet of moss, revealing a tunnel, you drop you bag down and hop in after, followed by Bisharp. He leads you a short distance through a series of twists and turns that would have confounded you by yourself. The tunnels widen into open space, and the sudden brightness forces you to cover your eyes.

When you open them back up your jaw drops, you seem to be inside an absolutely gigantic tree, it soars hundreds of meters into the sky and seems mostly hollow. The inside is latticed with growths and panels that support various platforms. The more you look the more astounded you become, "H-how did, how is, wow"

"Impressive right? It took years to build all this," You just nod and continue to take in the amazing sight. The area is filled with pokemon from multiple regions and of all types, most are moving about with some sort of purpose, several are selling wares off to the sides, and there are even a few that seem to be patrolling. You realize that they are starting to take notice of you and a few are openly staring. Bisharp notices as well and leads you into a hallway away from the crowd.

"I'm taking you to Alpha's workroom, she'll allow you to explain your story and then pass judgment" He continues down the hallway before stopping at a doorway obscured by ivy. He pulls the shroud apart and ushers you inside. The room is small, furnished only with a short table and a few stumps to sit on. Occupying one of these stumps is a Braixen. When it turns to face you it reveals a peculiar birthmark on it's hip.

"No," your body starts to shake, you know that birthmark "Mira"

Her eyes widen "Ethan?"
1111.title: Awake but not alone

11111.content:
"It's been so long" she hops off her stump and tries to hug you

"DON'T COME ANY CLOSER!"

"Aww, is that how you greet an old friend?"

"You are NOT my friend, don't pretend you've forgotten what you did,"

"I don't see what you're so upset about, you survived," she huffs

"No thanks to you,"

Throughout the exchange Bisharp has become noticeably uncomfortable, "So you know each other,"

"It was a long time ago," you speak softly, almost a whisper "Eleven years ago, I was a trainer, and she was my first and only pokemon. It started out great, she was exceptionally strong and we beat two gyms before she evolved," You grit your teeth, "But everything changed when she evolved. She was much more powerful, but she became conceited and when we finally lost a battle she blamed me. I'll admit it was partially my fault. A few days later, she led me out into the middle of the forest and just dissappeared, abandoning me,"

"Don't be such a baby, you're fine,"

"FINE? FINE! YOU THINK I'M FINE!?" dropping your bag you pull up the front of your shirt revealing the massive x-shaped scar covering the front of your torso. "A Zangoose hit me with an x-scissor, I WAS LEGALLY DEAD, fortunately a Gardevoir found me and was able to restart my heart, they dropped me off at the closest Poke-center"

"I-" you don't let her speak

"That's not even the worst of it, I had lost so much blood, I needed an immediate transfusion. Poke-centers don't stock human blood, I got a transfusion of Primape blood. It fucked up my brain, I can't control my anger, I KILLED A MAN YESTERDAY,"

"I-" she tries to interrupt "SHUT THE FUCK UP, you ruined my-,"

Suddenly you can't speak "Much better" Mira's eyes are glowing with power, "Now that I have your attention, listen up" she pokes you in the chest with her wand, "I apologize for abandoning you all those years ago, at the time it seemed like the best option," her gaze drops, "I came to regret that decision, I didn't think you would take me back, even if I could find you again, so I didn't even try," She sounds surprisingly sincere and you hate that you believe her, "I didn't know what you had gone through. I apologize" she releases her control over you "I'm going to offer you a choice, Stay here with us as part of the pack, or leave, no strings attached"

Despite having control of your voice back you still find yourself unable to speak.

"You don't have to answer now, take some time, think about it. Give me your answer tomorrow. I really hope you stay" she hugs you quickly and gestures towards Bisharp who ushers you out of the room. Once you are a good distance from the room he starts speaking,

"That was unbelievable, she killed the last one who yelled at her like that,"

"Not sure if I'm lucky or not,"

"Lucky for sure, Some of us would kill to be held in such high regard,"

"She's just trying to use me,"

"Well, after hearing your story I can't really blame you for being suspicious, but Alpha isn't like that, at least not anymore,"

Your stomach chooses this moment to announce its emptiness and you remember that you haven't eaten anything substantial in two days.

"Well, in the meantime let's get you some food," As you make your way back to the central area you feel a slight twinge in your head, before Mira's voice resonates in your ears,

"Attention all, we have a very special guest in our home today. His name is Ethan and he is a human. He is my friend, so give him the respect you'd give me, that is all,"

"Shit. Did she just tell everyone that I'm here?"

"What's wrong with that?" Bisharp asks, "No one will try to mess with you," "Maybe, but they will try to be all buddy-buddy to get closer to her, and that'll just piss me off,"

Bisharp takes you to one of the stands and grabs some cooked fish. You notice that he hands two small pieces of wood emblazoned with Mira's birthmark to the vendor.

"Currency? That's almost as surprising as the english," Bisharp hands you one of the fish and the two of you sit together at the side of the main hall. While you are eating you can feel the stares of most of the inhabitants as they pass. A few get too close for your tastes, and they receive your most sinister glare. Most back off, but one seems undaunted. To your irritation a Buneary walks right up and sits next to you.

"What?" you speak tersely trying to discourage the small rabbit,

"Are you Ethan?" "Yeah, so why don"t you just run along and-,"

She interrupts you with a slew of questions: where are you from, what are you doing here, how old are you, how do you know Alpha, and finally are you going to stay here.

"Go away," you don't even entertain the notion of conversing with her, you are tired, hungry, and overwhelmed. You eat in silence hoping she'll get bored but she just sits there watching you intently.

"Are you Alpha's mate?" You choke, and Bisharp whacks your back several times to dislodge the piece of fish.

"W-what makes you think I'm her mate?"

"It's spring,"

"What of it?"

"Mating season," Bisharp states, "I can see why she'd think that. Alpha has never taken a mate, and then here you are, you arrive just before mating season and Alpha calls you her friend. She doesn't call anyone her friend. I'd bet there are many who are thinking along these lines," you hang your head,

"Shit," you grumble to yourself, "No, I am not her mate,"

"Do you have a mate?"

"No,"

"Then why not be Alpha's mate?"

"Fucking hell, because I'm a human,"

"So? Pokemon mate outside their species," you groan

"It's different for humans," "How?" "Arceus dammit, I don't know it just is," She pouts for a moment,

"That's stupid," Apparently bored she runs off, and you sigh in relief.

"I hate kids, they have no restraint," Bisharp chuckles "I love that about them, there's nobody more honest than a child,"

"I'm sick of everyone staring at me, is there somewhere I can take a nap in peace?" you get to your feet. Bisharp thinks for a moment,

"Most of us sleep in a communal area, but I bet we could find you an empty room,"

"Alright, I just need my," you look around only to realize you dropped your bag when you were yelling at Mira. "Shit, I left my bag in the workroom,"

"Alright, lets grab it," As you get close to the room you hear several voices arguing,

"We can't allow a human to be wandering about our home, even if he is your friend,"

"I don't see what you're getting so worked up about, a single human is no threat to us. Also if he's Alpha's friend, then doesn't that make him a friend of everyone here?" you yank aside the veil

"Don't go deciding things like that on your own, I'll decide who my friends are,"

Mira has been joined by a pair of pokemon, on the left a wizened Staraptor, and on the right, an aged Quagsire.

"What are you doing here, this is a private meeting!" the Staraptor squawks

"Maybe you should Keep it down then, half the tree can hear you yelling," you fire back immediately. Mira giggles as the Staraptor puffs himself up indignantly,

"You insolent cretin, I could kill you where you-" he doesn't get to finish his threat as Mira pins him to a wall with Psychic.

"You're forgetting something very important," her voice drips with malice "Ethan is here under my protection, if you threaten him again I will not hesitate to break both of your wings and drop you into a ravine. Do I make myself clear?" he nods so quickly and furiously, you almost feel bad for him, almost. Satisfied, she turns to address you.

"So Ethan, you haven't made your decision already have you?"

"I'm here for my bag and I need a quiet place to sleep for a bit,"

"You haven't changed a bit, get a little food in your belly and it's off to sleep,"

"It's been eleven years. I'm not the same person you knew back then," She pouts for a second before smiling devilishly

"You're so cold, you must need someone to warm, you, up," she saunters up to you as she speaks and punctuates her three final words by walking her fingers up your chest.

"Where's my bag?" You deadpan

"I had it moved to where you'll be sleeping,"

"Okay, where is that?"

"My, room," you pinch the bridge of your nose

"Why? You know what, no, no I don't want to deal with this right now. I need to sleep. Where is it?"

"I'll take you, our meeting is over anyways. Thank you for your advice as always but I won't be taking it this time," Mira thanks the two advisors, and dismisses Bisharp.

"Shall we go?"

"Might as well," Mira takes your hand as she leads you towards the back of the tree. You're just tired so you let it happen. You quickly reach a room blocked off by purple ivy, and are led inside. Immediately you notice how nice it smells, it's a warm, comforting aroma that puts your mind at ease. Your bag is sitting next to the entrance, so you just grab your sleeping bag out of it and slide up next to a wall. You're asleep within a minute.
11111.title: "It's so good to see you!"

111111.content:
You are floating in a vast expanse of space, filled with stars and galaxies as far as you can see. You simply float and let go of your troubles for a while. You don't know how much time passes, and it doesn't matter, you are calm, you are at peace. It's a feeling you don't get much of in the waking world. Suddenly you realize you've started falling backwards, slowly at first but getting faster and faster. You roll over so that you are falling forward, only to immediately wish you hadn't. Your falling towards an endless expanse of a darkness so deep you can't even imagine escaping. You wake just before you fall in, sitting up in a cold sweat.

"Ethan?" Mira is kneeling next to you with her paw on your forehead, "Are you alright?" you breathe heavily

"It was just a nightmare, but it started out really nice," you shake your head, "Usually I just wake up like normal,"

"I'm sorry, it was probably me, you looked happy, I wanted to see what was making you so happy," she frowns "What were you dreaming about?"

"Just a place where I don't have to worry about losing my cool, where I can really relax," you sit there for a minute allowing your heart to slow back down. Her ears flatten out as you explain, and she avoids eye contact.

"Do-do you hate me?" For the first time since you got here she doesn't have the brazen overconfidence that you remember. If anything, she seems afraid of your answer.

"Why would you care?"

She begins to tear up "You were the most important person in my life, leaving you was the biggest mistake I ever made. I wanted to run back to you the very next day, but you would've never taken me back," she spills her heart out as she begins crying, exposing all the regret she had been dealing with, "I missed you so much, and I hated myself for abandoning you. You were my best friend. You only ever did what you thought was best for me, and I betrayed you. I can't fault you for hating me, how could you not hate me. I-I just want things to go back to the way they were," she wipes away her tears "I'm sorry, I'm so selfish, I made you suffer so much and I still want you to not hate me,"

After a moment of silence "I did hate you, for a while," you tell her, "But hating someone hurts, the more you hate the more it hurts, and I hated you with every fiber of my being. I realized one day that it hurt a lot more than it helped. So I let it go, little by little. I don't know if I'll ever be able to forgive you for that, but I don't hate you," you go silent again "Things aren't going to be the way they were, it's not possible, we've both changed," you pull her into a hug, "but that doesn't mean we can't be friends again," Mira lets out a soft cry and hugs you back with all her strength. You hold her until her sobs stop and she falls asleep. You pick her up and set her in her bed, before crawling back into your sleeping bag for another few hours of rest.

Your sleep is disturbed once more by someone calling for Mira, "Alpha? You're needed in the meeting room, there's been a dispute," at some point during the night she had gotten up and lain down using your stomach as a pillow. You gently shake her awake "Hey, get up they need you" "Hmm? Oh, right. Coming," she gets up and straightens her fur, "Help yourself to the fruit, I'll give you a full tour later, and Ethan?" she turns back to you before leaving, "Thank you," you get to your feet and stretch out your muscles, stiff from sleeping on the floor.

You take a moment to look around the room, having been too tired the night before. The room still smells wonderful and you are now able to place the scent, lavender. There is a small vase of the purple flowers on a wooden stand next to Mira's bed in the back of the room, which is more like a nest than a bed. Circular in shape and concave like a bowl, it's filled with various soft leaves and plants, and actually seems quite comfortable. Near the front of the room there's a small table with a few stools. In the middle of the table is a bowl of various fruits. Across the room from the door is a large circular window cut directly out of the tree and overlooking the forest to the east.

Now fully awake you're at a loss for what to do. Wandering around the tree would probably draw a lot of attention, and you're sure you'll get lost on your own. On the other hand just sitting around waiting would drive you crazy. Unable to decide you settle for doing some simple exercises, pushups, situps, squats. You finish up a few sets without really breaking a sweat, and decide to slip out of your shirt so it doesn't get soaked as you continue.

For years you had been using exercize to try to burn through your considerable anger, and as such you were in good shape. As you turn back to the center of the room you hear a quiet gasp from the doorway.

"Who's there?"

"U-um I was l-looking for Alpha, I-I didn't mean t-to stare," a small Whimsicott peeks through the ivy curtain, "A-are you Ethan?"

"Yeah,"

"Do you know where Alpha is?"

"She was called to a meeting a while ago,"

"Th-that scar," the whimsicott shuffles it's feet "How did you get it?"

"It's not the kind of story you'd want to hear," you brush off the request "And I don't feel like telling it either" just thinking about that day riled you up and you dropped into another set of push-ups.

"But that scar is huge! There has to be a good story behind it," Whimsicott insists.

"I said no," you growl and continue with your exercises.

"Please?" You reach the bottom of a push-up, pull your legs up under you, and stand in one fluid motion.

"You wanna know how I got this scar? Fine. My chest was ripped open by an angry Zangoose. Can you even imagine what that felt like? What it felt like to look down and be able to see your organs exposed to the air? No, you can't," You practically explode on the small Pokémon.

"Someone saved me but, sometimes I wish they hadn't. My brain got all fucked up, I can barely control myself. It was the worst thing that ever happened to me, so thanks for making me remember it," As you ranted you'd gotten closer and closer to the grass and fairy type until it was backed up against the wall, nearly cowering from your rage. You take a few steps back and pinch the bridge of your nose. "I'm sorry, it's a sensitive subject,"

"N-no I shouldn't have kept asking," the small Pokémon admits.

"Yeah, weren't you looking for Mira anyways?"

"Oh gosh, that's right!" Whimsicott jumps and dashes out of the room, leaving you alone once again. Your outburst had burnt up some of your anger leaving you relatively calm. You felt bad about yelling at the windveiled Pokémon, but there wasn't anything you could do about it now. Pushing those thoughts aside you focus on a more pressing matter, how you'll respond to Mira's offer.

She was essentially offering you asylum from the world of humans, where you were no longer welcome. You had made plans for this situation, knowing that it was a possibility, but this was a completely unexpected development. You had a lot to consider. They were lead entirely by Mira, who had apparently brought them all together and enforced some kind of government. She had even created currency, something unheard of from wild Pokémon. However you also had to consider that you were not a Pokémon and the chances of you being accepted without friction were next to none, your encounter with the Staraptor had shown you that much.

Thinking hard, you sit down on one of Mira's stools and grab a piece of fruit.

From what you had seen they were advanced culturally but not technologically, which made sense, most Pokémon had no use for technology.

"If I could provide a unique service that was useful, that would go a long way towards convincing them to accept me," you think aloud.

"I don't know, some of us really despise humans," you jump at the voice that appears right behind you. "It would take a lot to convince them," you steady yourself and turn to see who had snuck up on you, however there appears to be no one there. "Up here," you follow the voice up to see a Noivern hanging from the ceiling.

"Why are you up there?" You ask, slightly frustrated. "Because I can be, so why not?" You don't really have anything to counter that so you move on. "Okay, why did you scare me like that?" "I wasn't trying to scare you, you were just so absorbed in your thoughts you didn't hear me coming," the Noivern responds with a small smirk.

You grit your teeth, "Alright you're starting to piss me off, what do you want?" Instead of answering, the sound wave Pokémon flips off the ceiling and grabs a piece of fruit from the bowl.

"Alpha's a little busy at the moment, so she asked me to give you the tour," Noivern explains between bites of the Nanab berry, "And of course I had to see the human Alpha is so infatuated with,"

"Arceus, our relationship isn't like that," "Hah, then why did she have your scent on her?" "She used me as a pillow," you grumble. "See? That's my point, She's never been close to that intimate with anyone," you groan "Well we're friends and that's it, I still don't know if I should trust her,"

Noivern finishes its berry and leaps back onto the ceiling, "Alright, there's a lot to see so we should get started, now where to start?"
111111.title: Wake up (Night)

1111112.content:
You are lead to the base of the tree, where you find a complex system of caves.

"We use these caves as storerooms for food and other things. There's also an underground hot spring a little deeper," you take a look in one of the caves and see that the walls are covered in a chalky white mineral.

"This is saltpeter,"

"Saltpeter?"

"Yeah, saltpeter or potassium nitrate. It's used in gunpowder and can be used to preserve foods,"

"What's gunpowder?" You'd forgotten that they probably hadn't ever seen a gun.

"It's a powder used in special weapons humans developed, it's explosive," as you were about to leave you notice one of the caves was formed of a different kind of stone. "That's iron ore, it's the same as the stuff brought into the refinery,"

"What are you talking about?"

"A refinery is where metals are processed and made usable, I used to work in one,"

Noivern leads you to very top of the tree, explaining the general structure as you go, "The tree has two main sections, inner and outer. They're separated by stairways that lead all the way up and down. The inner section is mostly living quarters there's no real restrictions to it, you could sleep wherever you wanted, but I wouldn't recommend you try it. The outer section is workspace. Alpha has teams working on various projects and that's where they do a lot of it. Is this making sense to you?"

"Yeah," you're only half paying attention. As you head up the tree everyone you pass stares, and it puts you on edge. Fortunately there is only one other Pokémon at the top and they leave as you arrive.

"This is the birds nest, we usually have a few people posted up here to keep an eye on the area," the nest was a small circular platform that gave an almost perfect three hundred and sixty degree view of the area. You can see for miles in every direction. If you look hard enough you can almost see the towers of the refinery where you had worked. As you think about where you had worked you realize what you have that none of the Pokémon Mira has gathered could have.

"Hey Noivern, I need to talk to Mira. Do you know where she is?"

"Call me Stella," she glances at the sky, "Right now Alpha should be getting lunch, so she probably went back to her room. What did you want to talk to her about anyways?"

"How often do you have conflicts with other groups?"

"A few times a lunar cycle, why? And how did you know about that?"

You take the stairs down from the nest, "You live in a natural fortress, keep the entrances hidden, and have lookouts posted. You're either expecting an attack, or insanely paranoid,"

"Okay, but that doesn't answer my first question,"

You break out into a grin "I think I've figured out what I have that no one here does, what I can do that they can't,"

"And what's that?" Stella asks as she matches your pace.

But with armor you don't have to focus as much on protection and you're more free to attack, and weapons give you a means of attack that doesn't rely on your energy like moves do, so you're able to fight for longer," by the time you've finished your explanation you're almost at the ground floor.

"Relax, we aren't going to hurt you," one steps forward "If Alpha trusts you that's good enough for us," the other steps forward as well

"What are you talking about? I'm a human,"

11111121.content:
It starts with a small snort but it's not long before she's doubled over laughing like it's the funniest thing she's ever heard.

"Oh my Arceus, really?" She gasps as she wipes tears from her eyes, unable to stand upright.

"Yep, I've heard it from several people," you smile, her reaction confirming your understanding of your relationship,

"Oh that's funny. I mean I'll tease you all day long but, mates? Oh Arceus,"

"See Stella? What did I tell you?" The soundwave Pokémon crosses her arms and huffs. "Anyways I wanted to talk about what I'll be doing here,"

"Alright, have a seat," you sit across from her and begin explaining,

"I've been working in a refinery for years now, I can work with metal. You have a decent sized deposit of iron in the cave system, with some help I can use it to make tools, weapons, and armor," you pause for a moment, waiting for a response, when she doesn't say anything you continue, "I'll need a few things from my home and I might have to steal some things from the refinery. It won't be easy and I'll need help to get it started, but it's doable," Mira finishes one of her fish and taps the skewer on the table a few times in contemplation.

"What exactly would you need?"

"I'd need an area to work, someone to help mine the iron, some tools from the refinery, someone to help build the furnace and forge, and possibly someone to help with designing the armor as well as testing,"

"I like the idea of armor," Mira admits, "but you'll have to make so many different types and sizes for everyone here, are you really up to that kind of task?"

"I'm going to start with the simpler pieces, chest plates and helmets, I can work out more complex pieces as I go. It'll take some experimentation and time, but I'm confident in my skill,"

"How long would it take to make a single chest plate?"

"That depends, how large does it have to be, who'll be wearing it, should it be heavier or lighter? I can't say without that kind of information,"

"Alright, how long would it take to make one for me?" You stroke your chin for a moment,

"A day? Maybe two? Metalworking can't be rushed, if you go too quickly the metal will become brittle,"

"Alright, we'll give it a test run, make me some armor and we'll see how effective it is. If it holds up then you'll make more,"

"A challenge huh? Alright I'm game. First things first, I need to head back into town and grab a few things, it'll take a day to get there, so I need to get going now,"

"You want to hike back to a town that's probably looking for you everywhere? No, you'll be teleporting, I'll have Nanuk get you there, he's been close to the town so there shouldn't be any issues, just meet back up with him after you get what you need,"

"It'll have to be very early if I don't want to get caught by the refinery workers,"

"What do they have that you need?"

"Heat resistant clothes, and tools for shaping the metal," you step from the table to your bag, and start taking everything out. You stack all of your supplies in a neat pile on your sleeping bag. "Alright I'm ready," you sling the empty bag on your back, Mira nods looking off into space for a moment,

"Nanuk is here," she states before taking a sip from an earthenware mug. Sure enough a green wing parts the ivy curtain and a Xatu steps through. His gaze immediately focuses on you.

"Quite troubling," he mumbles as he stares, clearly unhappy with something.

"Got a problem?"

"You need to make peace with your past," he says as he nods sagely "only then will you be truly happy,"

"I gave up on being happy a long time ago," you reply bitterly, "I'd just ruin it," you look down for a moment, "Whatever, fuck that, let's just get going. I need to get into my house and then the refinery,"

"Very well," Nanuk presses his wings together before him and spreads them wide. Your mind is assailed by a violent lurch and strange patterns of light. The complete absence of sound is almost painful. Fortunately it only lasts for a moment but you still have to fight to keep from puking.

"It can be quite jarring the first time, however one becomes accustomed after a time," Nanuk offers his sage advice as you lean against a tree,

111111211.content:
Your house is taped off with the iconic yellow police line, but you don't see any officers in the area. There's only about ten yards of open space between you and the window you broke, it would only takes few seconds to get there, but you'd be completely exposed. The sun was still out, making it a gamble. You weren't about to trust your luck, so you wait until the sun is well below the horizon.

"It's dark enough, I'm going now," you whisper to your companion, "If I'm lucky we won't need an emergency teleport, but I'm not a lucky person," you admit as you stretch. You take a deep breath and sprint across what was your back yard. You slide into a crouch as you near the wall and peek through the busted window. It looks largely as you left it, but several items are arranged on your table as if under inspection. You reach through the empty pane and slide the frame up and out of your way before crawling in.

Leaving the lights off you take two duffle bags from your closet and fill one partially with clothes and a small solar charger. Leaving the empty bag by the window you grab a few books from a shelf, where you find an old file of medical records. You shove the books in the bag and are about throw away the files when you hear the telltale click of a pistol behind you.

"Put your hands up. Then turn around, slowly," you comply and are greeted by none other than Officer Jenny. "Ethan? You're still alive?"

"I guess you could call it that,"

"Why did you come back?"

You shrug nonchalantly, "Forgot a few things. So who called me in? It was Sharon wasn't it? She always was a bitch,"

"Why did you do it Ethan? It'd been so long, you were doing so well,"

"You know full well I can't control it," you respond "It's completely involuntary,"

"Then why don't you just come quietly, we can get the charges dismissed on insanity,"

"Sorry, I've got somewhere to be,"

"What are you talking about? You've been in the forest for two days, who could you have possibly made a commitment with?"

"You wouldn't believe me if I told you," you smirk

"Okay enough bullshit, you're under arrest," she takes a slow step towards you. "You have the right to remain silent," Jenny is extremely cautious as she approaches, she saw the results of most of your assault cases so she knows what you're capable of.

You take a quick step towards her making her flinch and raise her gun. "Nanuk," you suddenly find yourself back in the forest and hear two gunshots from your house. "She tried to shoot me!"

"You practically threatened her, I can't say I'm surprised," Nanuk voices his thoughts as you struggle not to vomit.

"Yeah you're right, anyways the next place I need to hit is the refinery on the south side of town," you slip the medical files you'd been holding into your bag, it wouldn't be good to leave information about yourself just lying around after all.

Despite the sickening sensation you agree that teleportation would be the safest mode of transportation, especially now that the police are probably combing the area, so you steel yourself and give Nanuk the go ahead. Once again the universe moves around you, and you find yourself on the roof of the refinery.

You're not sure but it seemed less severe than the previous time, maybe you're getting accustomed to it? Regardless you still feel sick and take a moment to shake it off. Once you're feeling better, you locate the roof access hatch and heave it open. It only gets checked once a month, so it's practically rusted shut and groans loudly. Setting the latch so it won't close by itself, you climb down the rickety ladder into the facility.

It's strikingly dark without the glow of molten metal, but you've been working here for years, you know where you're going. Your fist stop is the equipment storage room, where you grab a fireproof suit, gloves, and a face mask. Cramming the suit and gloves into your already packed bag you settle for just wearing the mask. You move on to the actual smithing area and strap on a tool belt. You slip as many of the tools as you can into its loops, but you have no choice but to simply carry a few.

You decide to only take the essential ones and make any others you might need later. With your load lightened, you make your way back to the rooftop.

"Did you get everything you need?" Nanuk asks as you climb through the hatch.

"There's too much to carry without that second bag, I'll just have to make a few of them once the forge is operational," you adjust the strap of your duffel bag "Let's head back, the police are probably out in force by now," you take one last look at the town you grew up in before the two of you disappear into the night.

Across the street laying in a ditch a man leans away from the scope of his rifle, "He's escaped, teleported away," he speaks into the radio strapped to his vest. "Copy that, returning to command," taking a pokeball from his waist he calls out a Pidgeot and is swept up into the sky.
111111211.title: Your house surrounded with police tape

1111112111.content:
Your stomach turns as you reappear in the main hub of the tree, but you tough it out and stay on your feet.

"I'm never going to get used to that," you force out.

"I think you're handling it quite well," Nanuk observes, "You very nearly vomited the first time,"

"I remember," you shake your head and pull off the mask, exposing your face to the cool night air. It's still dark, and there are only a few Pokémon moving about. You relish the feeling of not being the center of attention for a moment before adjusting the bag hanging from your shoulder.

"Alright, Mira's probably expecting me back in her room. Thanks for helping me out Nanuk,"

"It was my pleasure," the psychic type responds with a slight bow. "I hope we get the chance to work together again in the future," you nod and part ways, heading back to Mira's room.

You part the purple vines, and announce your presence.

"Mira? I'm back,"

"Ethan?" A sleepy mumble comes from the bed across the room, followed by a yawn. "How'd it go?"

"Not too bad, ran into a little trouble at my house but nothing Nanuk and I couldn't handle," you drop your spoils on your sleeping bag and take a seat next to it leaning against the wall.

"Wait, trouble? What kind of trouble," Mira questions, now wide awake and leaning over the edge of her bowl-like nest.

"Someone must've seen me sneak inside, and called the police. They sent someone who knows me. Long story short, they know I'm still alive. But that's all they know. Where I am, what I'm doing, and who's helping me are all still a mystery,"

"Well, that's not too bad I suppose," Mira says slowly, "It could've been much worse, and you got what you needed right?"

"Yep," you pat the bag "clothes, tools, books for reference, and this," you pull out the solar charger. "A charger for my phone. I didn't want to lose any of my music," you explain. "Now I just need a forge and I have a few ideas we'll need to talk about, but we can do that tomorrow, I need some sleep," You pull your shirt over your head and slip out of your jeans before curling up in your sleeping bag.

"Are you sure you don't want to sleep in the bed? It's way more comfy than the floor,"

"I'm sure," you reply quickly, not wanting to get caught up in her word games.

"Aww that's too bad, I was hoping for some company," you can almost hear her mischievous smile as she teases.

"I'm going to sleep, leave me alone," fortunately you're quite tired after the days adventure and you drift off quickly.

You woke slowly to a rich herbal scent.

"Good morning," Mira says brightly as you sit up, "tea?"

"Yeah, tea would be great thanks," you reply as you pull on some clean clothes. Your back pops loudly as you stand up getting Mira's attention.

"Okay, you're sleeping in the bed tonight," she states.

"Could you please just stop, it's not funny," you groan as you take a seat across from her, accepting the cup of tea she pours.

"I'm not joking, your back is going to hurt if you keep sleeping on the floor, and there's plenty of room,"

"My sleeping bag-"

"You can't lie to someone who can read your mind," Mira interrupts you with a flat tone, "Your back hurts. Now I don't like searching through your head so just tell me why you're so against sleeping in my bed,"

"I'm trying to draw as little attention to myself as possible, walking around smelling like you is only going to draw more attention to me and add fuel to the rumors,"

"So? Who cares about the rumors?" Mira counters

"I don't care about the rumors, I care that they make it harder for me to just live and work quietly,"

"You can't work at all if you're tired and in pain," she sighs and rubs her forehead, "I didn't want to do this but you're so stubborn. As the alpha, I'm ordering you to sleep in the bed tonight," she folds her arms and glares at you with all the authority she has.

You grind your teeth, there's no way for you to wriggle your way out of it now, "Fine," you growl, glowering at the table. As much as you hate it, you can't ignore a direct order. This is her pack and you are her subordinate now.

"Look I didn't want to do it, but you wouldn't be able to work like that," she leans close to you, "I am glad to hear that your issues weren't that you were opposed to sleeping with me," your head snaps up to meet her gaze. She's smiling, obviously trying to defuse the situation, but it just adds fuel to the fire. Gritting your teeth even harder you feel your grip tighten on your cup until it shatters, flinging small pieces of ceramic everywhere.

Mira yelps and falls back off her stool. You remain sitting and focus on the pain in your hand.

"Don't lose control," you repeat in your head until you feel the rage subside. "Mira, please stop making jokes like that. I can't handle it anymore," you don't wait for a response, instead beginning to pull the shards of ceramic from your palm.

"Stop! You're just going to make them worse!" Mira intervenes and begins pulling the pieces out with telekinesis, once she has most of the shards out she speaks again, "I'm sorry, I was just trying to lighten the mood. I didn't think you'd react like that," you twitch as she pulls out a particularly deep fragment, "I'll ease up on the teasing, but you're still sleeping in the bed,"

"Yeah yeah," once your hand is free of the ceramic you wrap it in some gauze from your first-aid kit, making sure it can still move freely.

"Make sure you keep it clean, an infection would be really bad. Now about your workspace, what will you need?"

"I'll need a small room, definitely not in the tree, and a forge,"

"Not in the tree?" Mira mumbles "Is the risk of a fire really that high?"

"Yeah, there'll be open flame and sparks, so I think in the caves would be best. If we can flatten out the floor of one of the chambers and create a few vents it'd be perfect,"

"But you would need help with that," she taps her chin with her wand a few times. "There are a few ground types who would be able to help, but I can only spare one at the moment," she closes her eyes for a moment. "Alright I've called them. They'll be here in a moment, I'll let you pick who you think is best suited for the job," Sure enough it's only a few minutes before two Pokemon enter the room. The first is tall and imposing with thick grey skin and a large spiral patterned horn. The second is shorter with thick brown and red fur and metal claws. A Rhydon and an Excadrill. You were about to choose the Excadrill, when you noticed its expression: disdain. It would appear that Excadrill severely dislikes you. While Excadrill is definitely better suited for the task, it's clear hostility makes you hesitant. In contrast Rhydon seems to be largely indifferent to your humanity. Excadrill would be able to complete the task in less time but there would likely be a good deal of friction between the two of you. While it would take longer with Rhydon but probably be easier overall.
1111112111.title: Continue

11111121111.content:
You make up your mind, you won't get anywhere by avoiding those who hate you. If you want them to accept you, or at least tolerate you, you'll have to prove your worth.

"Excadrill, you're better suited to this," the ground and steel type glowers at you, clearly against helping you in any way.

"Oho, an interesting choice Ethan," You're not sure if Mira is praising you or not so you just ignore it. "Gurren, you'll assist Ethan in creating an adequate space for him to work,"

"Very well Alpha," the voice is gruff but feminine, answering one of your unspoken questions. You grab your tool-belt, a hammer, and a heavy wedge. Slipping the tools into the belt you cinch it securely around your waist.

"I'm ready whenever," Gurren grumbles but accompanies you to the caves. You take a few minutes to select an appropriately sized chamber and describe what you need to her.

"I'm only helping you because Alpha asked me to," she states firmly.

"That's fine," you respond calmly "As long as you're helping," you pull out the wedge and hammer and start chipping away at the stone.

"What are you doing?" She asks with an incredulous tone.

"I'm getting started," you respond dryly as pieces of the iron rich stone fall to the ground.

"You won't make any progress like that," she points out with a tone of superiority.

"Well I'm not just going to sit around doing nothing. You're here to help, not do it for me,"

"It would be better for you to do nothing than get in the way,"

"If you work on that side I won't be in the way," you respond calmly, hiding your irritation. The only response you get is a hideous scraping sound. Gurren has started smoothing out the opposite wall, but seems to be making as much noise as possible. You grit your teeth and endure it, you can't allow yourself to be bothered so easily.

With Gurren's help it doesn't take long to get the room to the appropriate size, and you start on the floor. It's going well enough until you ask her to create a small pit in the center of the room.

"Don't tell me what to do," came the instant response.

"I'm not telling you to do anything, I'm asking," you pinch the bridge of your nose, "Fine, I don't need any more help, you can go,"

"If I leave who's going to dig your little pit," she asks with a smirk.

"I will," you reply simply driving your wedge into the ground to mark the center.

"It'll take you days by yourself,"

"Then I'll dig for days," you say simply

"What's wrong with you?" Gurren shouts,

"What's wrong with me? What's wrong with you?" You snap, "I've done nothing to you or anyone here so why do you hate me? Why?"

"You're trying to take Alpha away, we won't let you," she states with a glare.

"Even if I could force her to come with me, and there's no way I could force her to do anything, where would I go?" You throw out your arms, "I'm wanted, for murder. If I went back I'd probably be executed, and even if I wasn't they'd take Mira away, so it'd be a waste of time," you pause, "Your hate is groundless, and it'll consume you slowly. You should let go of it," you turn back to the hole and resume chipping away at the ground.

"What do you know? What could you know about hate, living a comfortable life in your city. Everything made easy and peaceful while we struggle out here to survive. Alpha is the only reason we're able to live as well as we do. We won't let you ruin our home,"

"You actually think that my life was easy just because I lived in a town? I've been suffering for a decade, sure I had food and shelter, but I lived in constant fear," you jab a finger in her face, "You've got no idea what it's like to know that you could go off the rails at any time and seriously hurt or even kill innocent people around you. I had to live like that for eleven years, and three days ago it happened, I killed a man in my rage,"

"I hate you because you humans are the source of everything wrong with the world," Gurren states with a venomous tone. You lift the front of your shirt to expose the massive scars on your torso.

"I got these because of Mira. She led me out into the woods and left me for dead. I was almost ripped in half, nobody could blame me for hating her. I had to get an immediate transfusion of Primape blood, it fucked up my brain. She is the cause of everything wrong with my life, but I stopped hating her years ago,"

Excadrill recoils at the sight of your scars.

"How could you survive wounds like that? How could you forgive someone for causing that?"

"I didn't survive, I died and was resuscitated, and I haven't forgiven Mira. I've just stopped hating her. Hate is like poison, it kills you from the inside," you turn back to the shallow pit you're trying to dig only for Gurren to push you aside and clear the space out in just a second.

"Don't get the wrong idea, I haven't accepted you yet, it's just that Alpha wouldn't be happy if I left before the job was done,"

The two of you return to the task of building the forge. A small circular pit with short walks erected around it, to be filled with charcoal. You had Gurren leave a small hole in the side to allow for a set of bellows.

"What are bellows?" She asks as you take a break, she

"Bellows are a kind of air pump. They force more air into the fire so it burns hotter. It'd be much harder to keep a forge at the right heat without one," you plan to make a simple foot operated bellows, so your hands wouldn't be too occupied to work the forge itself, and you could still regulate the temperature. "Need some leather," you mumble to yourself as you plan. With a shake of your head, you redirect your focus onto the forge, the short walls are cemented with clay and would harden after being heated.

Satisfied with the forge you move onto the next task: making charcoal. It's pretty simple, you just need to burn wood until it's completely carbon. Charcoal burns hotter than wood, allowing the forge to reach temperatures that can soften metals enough to be worked with. First things first though, you'll need wood.

"I think that's it Gurren. Now I just need some wood and I can get started,"

"Don't you need ore?" The steel and ground type asks amicably. In the past few hours the two of you had come to better terms with each other.

"I already have it. Most of the stone we cut away is iron ore, so I've got plenty for now," Gurren nods in understanding, stands up, and dusts herself off.

"I'm sure you'll need my help again, so don't be afraid to ask,"

"Thanks, I will," you offer your hand and after a moment she shakes it,

"You're a hard worker, that'll be enough for most of us to accept you, so just keep it up and you'll be part of the pack in no time," she gives you an unexpected grin and heads out of the cave. After taking a final look at the room, you do the same, and head back to Mira's room.

Mira is sitting at her table sipping from a cup of tea when you walk in, "How much of that do you drink?"

"Not THAT much," she says defensively, pulling the cup closer.

"Sure, anyway the room is ready, I just need a bellows and charcoal,"

"A bellows? What do you mean?"

"It's a tool to keep the fire burning at the right temperature, it's essentially a bag between two wooden planks that gets squeezed together to force air into the forge. The issue is going to be finding an airtight bag,"

"Why not just have a fire type regulate it for you?"

"That'd probably be too exhausting for a normal fire type. They'd need to be constantly monitoring and adjusting the temp, possibly for hours,"

"Why wouldn't you get tired doing that?"

"I won't be using nearly as much energy, I'd just be pressing down with my foot,"

"What if it was an extraordinary fire type?"

"If they want to try I'd welcome the help,"

"Alright, starting tomorrow I'll be helping you personally,"

"Don't you have things you need to take care of?"

"I can do both," she says confidently,

"I don't think it's a good idea," you voice your concerns, "You're already practically bending over backwards for me, any more would be too much. I know you don't think so, but I'm sure the pack will. I can't get preferential treatment, it'd seem like I was exploiting you," She almost seems to pout for a moment, before acknowledging that you're correct.

"I won't show favoritism, alright, but I'll at least be stopping by to check on you," she asserts.

"That's fine, probably," you submit to her demands, knowing she wouldn't back down any further. Seeming satisfied Mira returns to her tea, taking a short sip.

"Have you been to the spring yet?" Mira asks, "You should go today, you're covered in dirt and you smell,"

"Hey, I've been working all day, it's normal to smell,"

"I know but I'd prefer you bathe before we share a bed," you don't respond, you had nearly forgotten the events of that morning after all the progress you had made. "Let's go together," Mira gets off her stool and grabs your hand.

"Together? No, just show me where it is," you pull out of her grasp.

"Why not, we used to take baths together,"

"And I told you, we're different now, our relationship isn't going to be like it was back then," her ears droop and she relents,

"Alright, I'll show you where it is,"

She takes your hand again and hides the sad smile on her muzzle as she leads you down into the caves.

"Here we are, the hot springs,"

The cave is so full of steam it's difficult to see the other side, but you're able to get a general idea of its layout. It's fairly spacious and the center is filled with circular pools, the largest of which could fit twenty people comfortably while the smallest wouldn't even hold a child. Several of the pools are occupied so you head over to one of the smaller pools and pull off your shirt, but before you can remove your pants something gives you a shove. You tumble into the pool, luckily it's not deep but you bash your knee on the bottom.

With a grunt of pain, you stand up, the water reaching your stomach. At the edge are two Pokémon: a Vigoroth and a Dewott, both laughing madly. Your blood boils but you keep an even tone,

"Why did you push me?" You cross your arms and remain in the pool.

"That was a warning human, get out of here," the Vigoroth threatens, "Or you'll regret it," with a final laugh, the two leave and you allow yourself to calm down. You can see Mira near the entrance to the chamber, her fur bristling. She's clearly about to confront the two troublemakers, you gave her a wave and signal for her to stop. Still enraged she makes her way over to you.

"Why would you stop me?" She snarls, "They hurt you!"

"I'm fine, it's just a bruise, and I'm not just going to hide behind you. If they have a problem with me I'll deal with it personally, they'll never respect me if you fight my battles," you lean over the edge of the pool, allowing the hot water to soothe your body. "This feels nice,"

As you relax, a soft touch on your shoulder jolts you out of your calm and you practically throw yourself away from the contact. Unfortunately being half submerged in the pool greatly limits your mobility and you don't really manage to put any space between you.

To your chagrin, once you get a look at the invader of your personal space, it's one of the Lucario twins you'd encountered the day before, but which one?
111111211111.title: Resist

Despite the only part of her not submerged being her head, you're fairly certain it's Kara.

"Kara, please don't sneak up on me like that,"

"Sorry, but you're really jumpy. You should relax,"

You return to your position against the edge of the pool.

"Not gonna happen, at least not until nobody wants to hurt me," You turn and slide into a sitting position, leaving only the top half of your head above the water. It's almost painfully hot, but it succeeds in relieving some tension from your muscles. As you allow the heat to soothe your body Mira slips into the water next to you, but due to her height the water is just a little too deep for her to stand. When you make a move to help her she holds herself up with Psychic.

"Here," she holds out a clump of what looks like wax, "Soap, made from Combee wax and herbs," once again you're impressed by how civilized Mira's pack is. You take the soap and clean the exposed parts of your body. As you move to rinse yourself off Kara gets a good look at your chest,

"Oh Arceus," she covers her muzzle, "Th-those wounds!"

"I got them a long time ago, don't worry about it," you dismiss her reaction, after all it's a pretty normal response.

"What happened?" She asks stepping closer to see the full extent of the damage.

"Zangoose," you reply simply, trying to avoid the topic. You slip out of your shorts, making sure your lower body is concealed underwater, and quickly clean the rest of your body. When you finish you pull your soaked shorts back on, still underwater, and just allow yourself to soak in the hot water.

"Ethan, let me rub your shoulders, it'll help you relax," Kara offers after a minute or two. You're still slightly wary of the Lucario, but she's been amicable and with Mira right here trying anything would be foolish.

"Alright," you turn to show her your back. She wastes no time, starting to knead out the knots and considerable stress you've built up recently. Kara begins to use more pressure as she goes on, so much that it almost hurts but still feels good. Her touch softens after a moment but becomes burning hot. Hotter even than the water in the spring, and she's pressing into your skin. You tense up and grit your teeth, only to get a soft smack on the back of your head,

"Loosen up, this won't work if your this tense," grudgingly you allow your muscles to relax, and Kara continues her touch is still burning hot but it doesn't hurt, it just spreads through your body easing your aches and relieving stress you didn't know you had. When she finishes you're so relaxed you almost fall asleep right there.

Kara gives your shoulder a shake to make sure you don't and leans against the edge of the pool beside you.

"Don't fall asleep, we wouldn't want you to drown," she's joking but you know it's a real risk.

"I'm okay," you assure her, "just haven't been relaxed like this in a long time," you admit with a grin. Mira isn't in the pool so you assume she went back to her room.

"Would you mind returning the favor?"

"Uh-sure, but I have no idea what I'm doing,"

"You'll do fine," Kara assures you as she sits in your lap.

"What are you-? Shouldn't you just lean against the wall?" You try to lift her up but she's far heavier than you'd have thought.

"This is fine, it'll be easier for both of us," you can't see her face but you know she's smirking.

"Mira put you up to this, didn't she," it wasn't a question, you had no doubts.

"What? No," she said in the most sarcastic voice she could muster. You grumble but start rubbing the Lucario's shoulders. Starting with just circular rubbing you slowly begin kneading the firm muscle that comes from constant training.

As you continue to work her shoulders over, Kara groans appreciatively and leans into your touch.

"I thought you didn't know what you were doing," she says,

"I don't," you tell her, "I've never done anything like this before,"

"Liar," she grunts as you hit a sensitive spot, "This feels so good," after another minute of your ministrations she's practically putty in your hands, unable to hold herself up she leans back onto your chest.

"Okay, that's enough," she pants, "You don't need to make armor and weapons, just do that. Everyone will accept you real quick," She's breathless and has a hazy look in her eyes accompanied by a small smile.

"Hah, right as if most of them would even let me touch them," you slip an arm under her arms and the other under her legs. With a heave you're able to lift her up out of the water in a princess carry. She lets out a small yelp in surprise and blushes heavily. You set her on the edge of the pool.

"I need to get some sleep, I've got a lot of work to do tomorrow," you climb out of the steaming water. You grab your shirt from where you'd dropped it and head back to Mira's room. When you get out of the caves you see it's already dark, so you pick up your pace.

Mira's room is lit by a few candles and Mira is propped up in her bed reading one of the books you had brought from your home.

"Hey," she waves you over, "Can you do stuff like this?" She points out an image of a crown, "It's so beautiful," it is beautiful, solid gold with seven peaks and studded with rubies.

"Well, I could make one, but it would be made of iron, and that one is made of gold. It wouldn't be very pretty, and we don't have any rubies,"

"Oh," she thinks for a moment, "Why would anyone use iron when you could use gold?"

"Gold is a pretty weak metal, it melts easily and it'll bend. It's no good for armor or weapons. It looks good and it conducts electricity really well, but that's it, plus it's really heavy. That crown probably weighs like thirty pounds," as you explain the demerits of gold you grab a dry pair of shorts from your bag and slip out of your still dripping pair. You've slipped on one of the legs when you hear a stifled giggle. You hastily finish getting dressed and turn back to Mira.

She's holding the book up so you can't see her face. You grab the book by its spine and snap it shut. Mira's cheeks are bright red and she can't seem to meet your gaze.

"Well?" You ask with a sinister tone, "Satisfy your curiosity?" Her blush deepens and she nods almost imperceptibly, "Good, don't do it again," she nods again and you drop the book on the stack with the others. You squat to grab your sleeping bag and a small object rolls out.

"What's that?" Mira asks as you pick it up," you hesitate but answer,

"Your pokéball," you stare at it for a second "I should break it," you pop it open and prepare to tear it apart at the hinge,

"Wait!" Mira interrupts you,

"What? You want to keep this thing? If someone found it I'd be lynched!"

"Nobody's allowed in here without my direct order, it won't be found. Please?" You sigh and close the ball,

"If you get me killed again I'm gonna fucking haunt you," you toss her the decade old ball and feel a knot form in your stomach. She cringes at your warning, but smiles warmly as she holds the ball.

"I can't believe you still had it," she mumbles,

"I'll let you use another cup, just don't break it," she giggles at your expense. You grab the cup, which Mira fills with tea, and a Razz berry. The spicy berry goes well with the earthy tea, but you're still hungry. As if on cue a Medicham parts the curtain of vines, carrying a wooden plate stacked with slices of steaming fish. After placing the plates between you and Mira, Medicham bows and exits.

You quickly take a couple of pieces for yourself to sate your hunger. You hadn't had any real protein in days. It was confounding that many wild Pokémon could survive off of berries alone. You put these thoughts aside as you dig into the flaky flesh.

"So what are you doing today?" Mira asks as you finish your meal.

"I need to make some things for the forge, a grindstone, an anvil, and some bellows. "I'd like to start with the bellows, I'll need two wide, flat pieces of wood that are a couple of inches thick. I'll also need the help of a specific Pokémon, I saw a Leavanny my first day here. I need their help to make this work,"

"It's not as bad as it sounds," you reassure her. "Leavanny make clothes out of their thread right? I'll need a pretty thick bolt of cloth to make the air pouch and they're my best bet,"

You grimace, "I have a plan b, but it would be a huge hassle to operate and take days to set up. "Let's get started," you grab your survival knife from the backpack and pull it out if the sheath. The blade is slightly more dull than you'd have liked but it would have to do. You re-sheath the blade and tuck it into your waistband. "I need a few sturdy pieces of wood, do you have any in storage?"

"I'm sure we do, I'll have Bishop take you to the storerooms," she closes her eyes to summon them telepathically, "What did you think of him? It's difficult for me to get a read on him because of his type, but he's proven himself,"

"Bishop? I haven't met anyone named bishop," Mira cocks her head to the side,

"What do you mean? He brought you here,"

"Oh, he never told me his name. Yeah, he seems reliable,"

"Good, he'll probably end up helping you quite a bit," Mira smiles, "I'm glad you're finding your place here, I just wish the rest could see you the way I do," she leans on her paws a slight pout on her muzzle.

"I see you as,

I ruined your life, and you gave me a second chance to be part of your life, I will never forget that and I will always be grateful," a smile spreads across her face, "I remember back when we were traveling you always treated me as a friend. You even asked me not to punish those two who threatened you yesterday, which I think is foolish," her expression twists in anger for a moment but it fades, "You don't want to hurt anyone and I can see that you hate that you hurt those people, but that wasn't your fault,"

Her expression is one of admiration, sadness, andone you can't identify, one that's intensity worries you.

"You think too highly of me," you attempt to discourage her,

"You can't even see it yourself, but that's okay. You haven't changed, you still care about others" fortunately Bishop steps into the room at that moment,

"You called for me Alpha?" He nods to you in greeting as he addresses his leader.

"Yes," she hops off her stool and stands in front of the imposing Pokémon, "Please take Ethan to the storerooms and assist him with whatever he needs to do today," It's an odd sight, the five foot tall dark type taking orders from the three foot tall psychic.

"Of course Alpha," He claps you on the shoulder, "Settling in nicely?" You wince at the impact,

"Well enough. I'm ready, so let's get moving, I'll see you later Mira,"

"Have a nice day!" She calls as you head out, waving happily.

Bishop leads you down into the caves below the tree, past your forge and to a small unassuming passage. He makes sure the two of you are alone and pulls you into a small side room. Facing away from you he begins speaking.

Secondly she'll probably seek a lot of physical contact,"

"So, what do you want me to do,"

"Just don't hurt her," he grabs your shoulder in an iron grip, his eyes narrow, "If you hurt her, I'll hurt you,"

With a growl you drive your elbow into Bishops chest, knocking him off balance. You grab his neck with your free hand and shove him against the wall.

"I've made it clear to her that we are just friends, alright?" You punctuate your statement with repeated pressure to his neck.

"Alright, alright," he lets out a chuckle. "You're lucky you aren't strong enough to hurt me,"

"No you're lucky I didn't really lose it," you pull away "you'd have to kill me, and I don't think your dark type would protect you from Mira's wrath," silence hangs in the room as you point dramatically at the sword blade Pokémon.

"Heh..ha...Hahaha," bishop starts laughing and after a moment you join in, "You're insane, you're probably right, but you're still insane," he forces out through the laughter as you lean against the wall,

"Yeah, I guess I am," the two of you allow your laughing to wind down, "I guess we should get started,"

"Sure, sure. You needed wood right?" Bishop leads you up a few levels to an expansive room full of clay pots, barrels, and shelves. "This is where we keep most of our supplies: wood, water, herbs, it's probably here,"

"Great, is there a saw?" Bishop extends the blades on his gauntlets with a smirk, "Oh," you heft a section of log from a shelf, "Then cut here, here, and here," you direct the dark type to carve two planks of wood. Shaped like spades both sport a handle and half of a hinge, the only difference being the hole in the center of one.

"So what do you need these for anyway?" Bishop asks, examining one of the boards as you pick up some of the excess wood and start carving.

"These will be a set of bellows for the forge," you explain as you whittle away at the piece you picked up. "It's an essential piece of equipment. Now we just need the pouch," you trail off, focusing on the carving.

"What's all this!" You flinch as a voice erupts behind you, nearly dropping your knife. "Look at this mess! Wood chips, everywhere!" You turn to see a fuming Alakazam, "What are you doing?"

"I-I'm carving," you're somewhat at a loss for words, too surprised to get angry.

"Well why are you doing it here? Do you have any idea how hard it is to keep this place clean and organized?"

"Calm down Archie, we'll clean it up," Bishop intervenes. Grumbling to himself, Archie walks off around a corner and returns with a broom, "I'd better not find even a splinter when you're done," shoving the broom into your hands he stalks back off between the shelves and out of earshot.

"That's Archibald, he can be a bit irritable, but there's no one better at keeping inventory,"

"Right," you shake your head and hand your carving to Bishop, "Finish this for me would ya? It needs to be a straight rod," you sheath your knife and begin sweeping up the wood chips. As you're finishing up, a voice draws your attention.

"Bishop, are you here? Alpha sent me to find you and-" a Leavanny steps into the storeroom and as it's gaze meets yours it,

11111121111111212.content:
Her entire body begins to perceptibly shake. Her knees press together and she almost seems to shrink. Her voice fails her, so she simply stutters and pushes herself against the wall behind her, as far away from you as she can.

"Am I really that scary?" You ask. Bishop shrugs and approaches the terrified bug type.

"Hey, hey, relax he won't hurt you," he leans in closer, "and between you and me I don't think he could," she seems to calm down a bit so you step closer. She eyes you nervously, but doesn't cower. You still make sure to give her some space.

"I need your help with something," you lean on the broom, "Did Mira tell you what I need?" She nods, "Alright, will you help me?" She blinks and cocks her head slightly to the side, "You don't have to, you're clearly not comfortable with me,"

"See?" Bishop gives you a friendly shove, "he only looks mean," you shove him back, smiling. The friendly back and forth seems to put her even further at ease.

"I-you aren't what I was expecting," she admits, looking off to the side. "There are lots of rumors, and most are bad,"

"Yeah? What are they saying?"

"They say you are hostile, rude, and trying to take advantage of Alpha,"

"Well, the first two are debatable, but I'm not taking advantage of Mira. I'm actually going to be a benefit when I get my forge up and running,"

"What exactly will you be doing? And how could I help?"

"I," you gesture into the air, "will be making armor and weapons for the pack. That would provide a distinct advantage against other groups,"

"What good would armor do us?"

"What if everyone we sent into battle had the defense of an Aggron, regardless of their species? Can you imagine the advantage that would give us?"

"Could armor really make anyone that tough?"

"Sure, if it's well made,"

"And you can make armor like that?"

"Well, I've never done it before, but I know how to do it,"

"I see," she says, clearly not very confident. "I guess I'll just have to believe you. What did you need my help with?"

"Right now I'm working on a way to control the temperature of the forge, but I need a pouch that's mostly airtight, and secured between these two panels," you hand her one of the panels to examine, "What's your name anyways?"

"Taylor," she takes the panel and manipulates it with surprising dexterity considering her lack of hands.

"Hey we should get moving if you don't want Archie to yell at you again," Bishop interjects.

"Yeah, let's go. That was," you hesitate, looking for the right word, "unpleasant,"

On the way back to the forge room you explain more of your plans to Taylor.

"Can you really make something like that?" Taylor asks clearly doubtful.

"It'll take some trial and error, but I'm sure I can,"

"I don't know," Bishop chimes in, "That sounds pretty complicated,"

"I'll show you, in a few months we'll all have," you freeze as you step into your smithy.

Bishop steps forward, placing himself between you and the pair of aggressors. While Taylor hurries out of the room.

Bishop has no trouble simply slapping him out of the air as he gets close.

"If you leave now we won't hurt you," he offers.

"Well I gave you a chance," he sighs and draws one of his two scalchops, water flowing from the edge, forming a blade.
