You don't even have a chance to draw your knife as Vigoroth charges you from the side. Claws meant for your eyes slice through your hair as you stumble away, heart pounding. The second strike hits home in your stomach, driving the air from your lungs and you to your knees. You had thought you'd been hit hard, you'd fought Pokémon before, but never like this, with your life on the line.

You could feel it coming on, the rage. Your blood boiling, the air you breathe frozen. The pounding of your heart made it hard to think and so easy to let go. With a primal roar you black out.

Bishop had never seen anything like it. A human fighting like that? Before he would've said it was impossible, but Ethan was full of surprises.

The scream that pierced his ears was nothing short of hideous, like pure hate made sound, and the way he fought? Merciless. Any human would surely have fallen under the force of such blows. Vigoroth however, was putting up an admirable resistance.

Harsh punches and brutal kicks thrown by the berserk human had only minor effect on the normal-type. Ignoring defense completely Ethan threw himself into the fight with a disturbing vigor, yelling and screaming. The multitude of cuts and bruises he received seemed only to drive him further into his rage.

All present had stopped to watch the brutal melee. Too horrified to allow it to continue Bishop moves to separate the two, receiving a heavy punch to the face and the full attention of the bloodied human.

"That actually hurt," Bishop states incredulously as he rubs his jaw. Ethan snarls and clenches his now bleeding and skinned fist tighter, before taking another wild swing at his friend. "You've got good power, but no control," the dark type continues as he neatly sidesteps the punch.

Screaming furiously the man pulls back for another massive swing only for his legs to be swept cleanly out from under him. Grasping his arm and twisting it behind his back Kara immobilizes the raging human.

"I could hear you all the way upstairs, what are you doing?" She asks, practically shouting in the prone mans ear. The only response is another yell, just as angry, but clearly pained. "What's gotten into you?"

"He went wild when these guys attacked us," Bishop informs her "He did mention that he could lose control when he gets angry. Ugh, he hits really hard for a human," he continued, rubbing his jaw. Squatting down he takes a closer look at the struggling human. Now that he wasn't trying to kill him he could see the raised veins on the side of his forehead and the dialation of his eyes. Those same eyes were constantly flicking back and forth searching for a way out, but focused on Bishop as he came closer. A feral snarl warned him to stay back but pinned down as he was there was nothing he could do.

"He's completely out of it, he doesn't recognize me at all," Bishop gets back onto his feet, "What should we do with him?" Kara pulls Ethan slightly off the ground and he starts thrashing trying to free himself.

"Let's have Alpha come take a look at him," Kara pushes him back into the ground. "No hurry, he won't be able to get away from me,"

"Good idea, but first," he turns to Vigoroth and Dewott with a dark look on his face, "You two. If you attack Ethan again I promise you will regret it. Now get out of here,"

"You're not gonna turn them over to Alpha?" Kara asks, surprised, as the two made their escape.

"Not this time, it's more important that we get him back to normal. I'm going to get Alpha, at the very least she should be able to calm him down," He ran off leaving Kara to hold the raging human.

"What happened to you huh?" The Lucario mumbles, mostly to herself, "Why are you like this? Is it related to that huge scar on your chest?" His only response is to keep growling, apparently unable to understand, much less explain himself. "Yeah that's what I thought you'd say," leaning back slightly the fighting type shifts her weight to a more comfortable position and lets out a sigh, only to have to throw her weight back onto Ethan as he began to thrash anew. "Stop struggling, Arceus!"

With one hand behind his back in a very restrictive position Ethan's movements were severely limited, but not completely stopped. Moving his free hand under his chest, the human shoves himself up off the ground with a feral scream. The huge push takes Kara off guard and throws her off Ethan's back allowing him to roll to his feet.

Kara is knocked off her feet and similarly rolls into a ready stance. Ethan charges in but gets thrown easily to the ground. Pressing her paws together and drawing them apart with a flourish Kara creates a bone staff and swipes at Ethan's legs as he attempts to rise again, sending him crashing back down.

Before he can get to his feet Kara presses the end of her staff into his neck,

"Stay down," she growls, "you're being very annoying," Ethan lashes out with his leg striking the Lucario on hers. Snarling and at the limit of her patience, Kara swings the staff at the offending appendage, receiving a pained yelp from the downed human. "Oh Arceus, I'm sor-," she began only for Ethan to tackle her and try to slam her head into the stone floor. "That's ENOUGH!" With a yell Kara drives her palm into Ethan's stomach and fires off a Force Palm. The shockwave throws him clear across the room, where he slumps to the ground, unconscious.

Sitting down next to the injured human Kara gently moves him so his head is resting on her lap. "I'm sorry you had to go through that. It must really hurt, I had to hit you seriously there at the end," she wiped a bit of blood from his face as she spoke, "I can't imagine living the way you do, constantly afraid you might get set off, you're truly strong," she brushes a bit of stray hair from his face and leans in slowly.

"ETHAN!?" Startled Kara jerks back from the unconscious man as Mira rushes into the room in a panic. "WHAT DID YOU DO TO HIM?" The small fire type practically blazed with power, fully prepared to annihilate the fighting type.

"He got free and he just wouldn't stay down so I had to knock him out," Mira seethes for another few moments before speaking,

"We'll discus your methods later, is he alright?" The fire fox kneels down beside the sleeping man and wrings her paws nervously.

Kara rubs the side of your head smiling gently "He's asleep now, we'll have wait for him to wake up," however her smile doesn't go unnoticed by Mira. "What are you smiling about? You could have seriously hurt him," Mira fumes,

"I-i don't really know, I like having him here like this, it feels," she pauses, "it feels right," she finishes with a small smile.

Scowling, Mira floats Ethan into the air and towards the door, "Get someone to clean up in here, then come see me in my room, we need to talk in private,"

Mira was practically beside herself. Ethan had been beaten so badly, he not only had an episode and went berserk, but was currently unconscious. No matter how ferocious or tenacious, he was still only human, and humans are fragile. She had to make sure he was safe. Safe from the two who had attacked him and safe from that harlot Kara.

“We’re together again after all this time, I won’t let her get in between us,” she declares under her breath.

“I’m not trying to come between you,” Mira jerks in her seat almost falling, “I can have a relationship with him that doesn’t jeopardize yours,” the aura Pokémon steps into the room. “I just want to be friends,”

“I saw the way you were looking at him,” Mira sneers, “It wasn’t the look of a friend,”

“Would it matter if it wasn’t? Your relationship with him isn’t romantic either, so what would be the problem?” Kara knew what the problem would be, she could feel Mira’s anger reach the boiling point.

“He is mine,” Mira declares through clenched teeth. Her eyes blaze with power as she stands before the larger canine, “With my authority as Alpha you are forbidden from seeing him again,” Kara stands before her, unimpressed.

“How do you plan on enforcing that? Are you going to spend every waking moment with him? How would you get anything done? How would he? Besides if you made such an order you would lose the respect of most of the pack,” Kara crosses her arms, we follow you because we respect you. If that respect was gone who knows what would happen,” Even as angry as she was Mira knew she was right, a selfish and ridiculous declaration like that would be very damaging. Her grip tightens on her wand.

“So you expect me to just let you take him from me?” Mira’s voice cracks, “My best friend? The one who means more to me than anyone? No, I won’t let you,” Kara leans down and pulls her into a hug.

“I don’t want to take him from you, I just want to be his friend,” she pulls back paws on Mira’s shoulders, “For now,” she adds silently. “Okay?” After contemplating for a moment Mira reluctantly concedes,

“Fine, but just his friend,” she wipes the moisture from her eyes, “And we still need to talk about how you handled the situation in there,” Mira gets back into her seat, “You could’ve killed him,” Kara clicks her tongue in an annoyed fashion, she’d hoped Mira would forget about that,

“He’s not so weak that that would’ve killed him,” she says dismissively, “He’s strong enough to fight a Vigoroth to a standstill,”

“He was out of control and took Vigoroth by surprise, in a normal fight he’d have lost,” Mira insists, “You didn’t have to blast him into the wall,” Kara smirks,

“You’re underestimating him Alpha, you didn’t see him in action. If I hadn’t knocked him out he might have actually been able to hurt me,”

“Strength aside he’s still a human, they cant take real blows from Pokémon like that. As punishment for your rash actions and endangering one of our own, I’m assigning you to protect Ethan from now on,”

“I’m telling you I didn-. W-what?”

“It’s now your responsibility to protect him from the members of our pack that want him gone. I can’t be with him at all times, and as long as you don’t hit him,” Mira glares pointedly, “You’re one of the best suited to protecting him,”

“I wont let anyone hurt him,” Kara promises,

“I’ll hold you to that,” She says, “Now come with me, let’s see how he’s doing,”

You awoke to the sound of quiet, rustling above you, and a cold, slimy sensation on several parts of your body. Opening your eyes proves to be a mistake as you’re blinded by a harsh light. Shielding your eyes you try to sit up but are gently pushed back down.

“Where am I?” You finally ask.

“You’re in the infirmary, you got beaten pretty badly.” as your eyes adjust you can make out the shape of a small pink and cream colored Pokémon, “My name is Joy and I’ve been patching you up,” the Audino claims happily.

“Your name is Joy?”

“That’s right, is something the matter?”

“No, just reminded me of someone,”

“Alright, well sit still, I’m almost finished,” you comply as Joy applies a blue paste to a leaf and places it over a cut on your leg. “This is an Oran berry paste, normally I’d just heal you with Heal Pulse, but I’m afraid it doesn’t work on humans,”

“Thanks,” you pause, “What exactly happened? I don’t remember anything after I was attacked,”

“Sorry, I don’t really know the details, you were brought in here a few hours ago covered in cuts and bruises, and a particularly large one in the middle of your stomach. If it had been higher it might’ve broken some ribs, so that’s fortunate,” She explains as she double checks the paste, “You’ll have to take it easy for a few days, and try not to get in any more fights, I can’t guarantee I’ll be able to patch you up,”

“I’ll try,” you respond as you look around the room, it’s not very large, and is mostly occupied by the table you’ve been laid out on. There’s a hole in the ceiling, presumably for light, and shelves across all the walls filled with earthenware pots and jars. The door, like most in the tree, is blocked by a curtain of vines which draw your attention as they’re thrown aside revealing Mira and Kara.

Before you can even greet them Mira has thrown herself at you knocking you back onto the table.

“You’re okay, I was so worried,” she holds you tightly, but all you can do is yelp as she collides with your battered body, “Oh Arceus I’m so sorry,” hastily letting go, she settles for leaning over you and inspecting your wounds.

“I’m sorry too,” Kara stands next to the table, head bowed, paws clasped in front of her, “I wasn’t expecting you to resist so much,”

“What exactly happened? I don’t-“ you hiss as Mira touches a particularly sensitive spot and push her paw away, “I don’t remember,”

“Well I wasn’t there for all of it, but from what I saw, and felt,” she grins, “you’re exceptionally strong for a human. You were able to fight that Vigoroth to a standstill,”

“That is not what happened,” Mira interjects with a glare, “You were hurting yourself almost as much as him,” she grabs your hand, “look at your knuckles you nearly broke them,” as she said your knuckles are skinned and swollen, with more of the Oran berry paste applied. “You can’t get in another fight like that, if Bishop and Kara hadn’t been there you would have died,” she presses her head into your shoulder, “Please promise me you won’t fight again, please?”

“I’ll try not to fight,” you reassure her wrapping your arms around her shoulders, “I don’t want to get hurt either,”

“No!” she shoves your arms off and locks eyes with you, she’s beginning to cry, “Promise me you won’t fight again,”

“What if I get attacked? You can’t just expect me to let someone just beat me up,”

“You won’t need to do anything, as of today Kara will be protecting you,”

“That’s right,” the Lucario puffs out her chest proudly, “I’ll be watching over you so you don’t need to worry about a thing,”

“Y-you can’t just expect her to drop everything and devote all her time to me, that’s completely unreasonable. Besides, I thought you weren’t going to be giving me any special treatment,”

“I hardly think giving someone who has been assaulted a bodyguard is special treatment, especially since you’re incapable of properly defending yourself,” she adds pointedly, squeezing one of your battered hands.

You don’t respond, simply because you can’t. Her reasoning is sound, you don’t remember but based on how your body feels, you were nearly torn to pieces in that fight.

“Fine, I’ll be in your care Kara,” when you finally respond, it’s quiet and reserved, “I’m still in pain and exhausted, I’d like to get some rest,”

“Oh, alright,” Mira’s ears flatten and she releases her grip on your hand, “Thank you for treating him, Joy,”

“Of course,” the Audino responds and bows slightly,

“Kara, if he gets a single new scratch on him I’ll be holding you responsible,” The Lucario simply nods, “and Ethan?” After a moment of hesitation, Mira pulls you into a quick hug, kisses your cheek, and hurries out of the room.

“So, there is something between the two of you,” Joy muses aloud.

“No-no there isn’t, she’s just not thinking clearly,” you attempt to deny “tell her Kara,” but Kara doesn’t respond.

The aura Pokémon is too busy glowering at the doorway to even hear what you said.

“Kara?” You cautiously shake her shoulder, and she snaps out of her thoughts,

“Y-yeah?”

“I was just telling Joy that there’s nothing going on between Mira and I, what are you looking at?”

“Oh-um, I was looking at, uh, Alpha’s aura. It’s very, uh, agitated,” You can tell she’s lying, but if she has an issue with Mira that’s none of your business.

“Okay, well I’m going to take a nap and then I’ll probably head down to the forge,”

“A-alright,”

You lay back down and Kara makes herself comfortable in the corner, settling down to meditate while you rest. As you drift off you can see her sensory organs shift unnaturally, as if blown by the wind.
